category: Player Registration Regulations/Article 23 (Activity Restrictions and Exceptions)
contents: Article 23 (Activity Restrictions and Exceptions) ① Member sports organizations may determine the minimum period of enrollment at their school or organization for athletes to participate in various competitions according to the circumstances of the member sports organization. However, if a first-year student at each level school or a first-year affiliated organization and a person who studied abroad returns to their original affiliation, they can participate in the competition as of the end of March. ② Athletes who have submitted their intention to give up activities in writing to the member sport organization, or people who have not registered as a player for more than two years without a special reason recognized by the member sport organization, may become a player after one year has elapsed from the date of application for new athlete registration. You can do activities. However, exceptions are made for athletes registered for training purposes and athletes registered for recreational sports purposes. ③ Member sports organizations may decide on the registration and participation in competitions for athletes from professional and similar organizations. ④ If an athlete receives disciplinary action, a member sports organization shall restrict activities in accordance with the disciplinary action. ⑤ Member sports organizations may restrict the activities of athletes who have registered for professional sports purposes according to the participation guidelines for recreational sports competitions.
